title: Notification issues!
text: Telegram has always been a perfect messenger. However, in the latest version, there is this irritating notification issue. Whenever I check out my messages on another device(e.g., desktop app), I get a notification on my phone for no apparent reason! Even though I read messages from muted channels and chats. It's just extremely frustrating!

title: Starred Messages

title: Grateful for this App
text: I am grateful that Telegram provides an alternative to the huge apps that do similar things. I do not like it that Apple and Google penalize regular everyday people when they have reasonable objections to how they treat many users because of disagreement and censorship. I hope Telegram continues to grow and promote dialog and that the INDIVIDUALS who may misuse it are held accountable, and not anyone else. The definition of what is safe needs to be defined by others than those who enforce it.

title: No way to prevent spam
text:
I had to stop using this app because I receive spam (and phishing) from unknown senders on it every day. Telegram doesn‚Äôt let its users block or filter messages from unknown senders (as in, not in contacts) unless you‚Äôre a notable public figure, what I can tell. They don‚Äôt specify what the requirements are to gain access to the basic feature of being able to stop spam.

You can‚Äôt even disable push notifications from unknown senders unless you disable notifications for all messages in the entire Telegram app. Oh well. Bye.

title: Translate entire chat feature broken!!
text: Latest update broke this feature. I tapped on show original and now have lost the ability to translate the chat? It works if I choose another language for the app but with English it does not give me the option to translate and now I‚Äôm having to use the translate option from the menu to translate individual lines. Fix this!! It‚Äôs the only reason I bought telegram premium!

title: One of the worst UX ever.
text:
The messenger is constantly loosing it‚Äôs state.

You can read something, or even worse, you can write something, then you switch for a split second to another app, e.g., to check something or to copy-past something and it restarts, and you has to manually find the place where you was.

It also checks a message read, once it appears on the screen, not when your scroll to its end. As the result the once the messenger restarts, and you find channel on which it has stopped, you need to scroll back. Also, if there was only one unread message in the channel, aster restart the channel is marked completely read which makes it more complicated to find.

It might be ok if you receiving a few messages per week, but it is not designed ti provide a comfortable experience for those who has over a dozen of active channels hundreds of daily messages.

title: Banned personal numbers?

Tried reaching a Helpdesk via that prefilled out form email. Nothing. It is ridiculous! No support at all so find someplace else until the folks here are more responsive!  -1 star
